summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Bed & Breakfast
Review Date: 2014/03/12
Categories: Comedy, Charming, Cheerful, Emotional
Product Description: ['In this charming romantic comedy, Jake inherits a small bed and breakfast in California wine country.  Problem is, so did sultry Brazilian Ana. Her life is complicated ... his is worse.']
Average Rating: 3.6
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Marcio Garcia'], 'Starring': ['Dean Cain', 'Juliana Paes', 'Bill Engvall']}
Review Text: I really liked this show, I would recommend it to my friends and I would watch it again if I chose.
Review Title: Very enjoyable!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: iWorship MPEG Video Library O-R
Review Date: 2014/04/14
Store: Various  (Actor),     Integrity Music  (Director)    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Music Videos & Concerts
Product Description: ['MPEG VIDEO LIBRARY O-R', 'The Total Multimedia Experience Expands!', 'Integrity iWorship MPEG Video Library O-R', 'features the entire video songlist from Integrity iWORSHIP Resource System DVDs O through R. Each video is put into an MPEG format, which is a high quality computer file of digital video. This 28 video song collection gives users flexibility to choose any number of songs and compile unique, seamless worship sets. 4 DVD-Rom discs and 3 file versions for each title are included, giving you a full mix, split trax mix, and click trax mix of every song! You can compile seamless worship sets right from your computer! And it is playable through PowerPoint, Song Show Plus or Media Shout.', 'Songlist:', '1. Love The Lord (Lincoln Brewster)', '2. Saviour King (Hillsong)', '3. Sing (Travis Cottrell)', '4. Mighty To Save (Hillsong)', '5. New Doxology (Gateway Worship)', '6. Rising (Paul Baloche)', '7. Hosanna (Hillsong United)', '8. Our God Saves (Paul Baloche)', '9. For All You ve Done (Hillsong)', '10. In Christ Alone/Solid Rock (Travis Cottrell)', '11. From The Inside Out (Hillsong United)', '12. You Are God Alone (Phillips, Craig and Dean)', '13. Today Is The Day (Lincoln Brewster)', '14. Welcome In This Place (Hillsong)', '15. Because of Your Love (Paul Baloche)', '16. God You Reign (Lincoln Brewster)', '17. The Lord Reigns (Gateway)', '18. Came to My Rescue (Hillsong United)', '19. Hungry (Kathryn Scott)', '20. You Are My King (Various)', '21. You, You Are God (Gateway) 22. Ancient Words (Robin Mark)', '23. Fairest/ Fairest Lord Jesus (New Life)', '24. Grace Like Rain (Todd Agnew)', '25. He Leadeth Me (Candi Pearson-Shelton)', '26. How Great Thou Art (Paul Baloche)', '27. I Am Yours (Michael Neale)', '28. Rock of Ages You Will Stand (Paul Baloche)']
Average Rating: 4.1
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Religious & Inspirational', 'Format': 'NTSC, MPEG', 'Contributor': 'Integrity Music, Various', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '4', 'Package Dimensions': '8.31 x 5.51 x 1.14 inches; 5.6 Ounces', 'Director': 'Integrity Music', 'Media Format': 'NTSC, MPEG', 'Run time': '1 hour', 'Release date': 'November 10, 2009', 'Actors': 'Various', 'Studio': 'Integrity Music', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '4'}
Review Text: I was hoping to put it in my DVD player to watch but was not able to. Was very sad.
Review Title: Like, but was unable to watch on DVD.
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------

Also starring Caroline Catz (Murder in Suburbia), Ian McNeice (Dune), and Emmy winner Eileen Atkins (Cranford).', 'Review', 'Sweet, stirring, and completely addictive. --SlateA smart, gentle comedy with loads of wit and zest. --The Globe and Mail (Canada)Delightfully quirky… an eccentric comedy full of lovable oddball characters. --Los Angeles Times']

raw_response:
POSITIVE SUMMARY:
The user's purchase history reveals a strong preference for charming and enjoyable shows, often rated highly with maximum ratings given. They expressed enthusiasm for various comedies and heartfelt content, indicating that they found these experiences uplifting and worth sharing with friends. The user appreciates quality entertainment that is engaging and emotionally resonant. Additionally, there is a notable trend of positive feedback regarding family-oriented content, highlighting a consistent enjoyment of shows that cater to both parents and children alike. 

NEGATIVE SUMMARY:
On the downside, the user encountered some disappointment related to a specific product that failed to meet expectations, particularly in terms of playback compatibility. This lack of functionality led to frustration, impacting their overall satisfaction. Mixed ratings were also noted for some items, suggesting that while there were enjoyable experiences, there were also moments of dissatisfaction that detracted from the overall enjoyment.

OVERALL SUMMARY:
Overall, the user's shopping behavior reflects a love for heartwarming and entertaining shows, often with high ratings and strong recommendations. Their positive experiences suggest a preference for joyful and charming narratives, especially those suitable for family viewing. However, some negative experiences, particularly related to playback issues with specific products, indicate occasional challenges in meeting expectations. Despite these setbacks, the user remains drawn to various genres that offer emotional engagement and enjoyment.

target_interaction.title: Review
target_interaction.text: Love this show! We need another one just like it!
description: All is not well for brilliant but boorish Dr. Martin Ellingham (Martin Clunes, Manhunt) as the hit British dramedy returns. To Martin’s utter disgust, his medical practice remains under official scrutiny because of his pre-existing blood phobia, and he is forced to attend refresher courses starting with phlebotomy. His wife, Louisa (Caroline Catz, DCI Banks) and aunt Ruth (Emmy winner Eileen Atkins, Cranford) urge him to take this risk to his career seriously, but events conspire against him.  While Louisa focuses on her own job change and studies child psychology, she worries that their son, James, is becoming too much like his father, and decides James needs a sibling. As the other residents of picturesque Portwenn contend with love and life changes, Martin remains stuck in his ways. Can he appease the medical board or will his days as the village GP soon be at an end?
